channel.title: Kyle McDonald
channel.description: Experimental visual and sonic art. Interactive generative media alongside more traditional techniques.

item.title: Only Everything Lasts Forever
item.description: Four hour-long excerpts from my thesis (beginning, two from the middle, one from the end) are now posted.

item.title: ...and Counting, Lagoglyphs, Night Lights
item.description: ...and Counting for Wafaa Bilal was just featured on Infosthetics. Lagoglyphs: Animation I for Eduardo Kac just opened in Brazil. Night Lights documentation from October 2009 in Auckland, NZ is now up.

item.title: vibrobyte
item.description: Just uploaded a paper and some other info on past haptics + telepresence with the "Vibrobyte".

item.title: keytweeter & new site
item.description: http://rpi.edu/~mcdonk/ is now deprecated. Please use http://kylemcdonald.net/ instead. In other news, I have a new piece up: "keytweeter". A custom keylogger, it tweets every 140 characters I type.

item.title: Machine Dreams: pppd
item.description: A recent iteration of pppd is in Machine Dreams at Space CAN gallery in Seoul, South Korea. Curated by Byeong Sam Jeon. The exhibit has been featured on YTN and MBC.

item.title: Portrait Machine
item.description: "Portrait Machine", an interactive photography installation I've created with Theo Watson, just opened last week in Amsterdam. More on vimeo, and info about the exhibition from CBK

item.title: Simplify
item.description: Further simplification, delocalization, and contextualization. Images are on Flickr. Processing apps on OpenProcessing. Videos on Vimeo. New work on both Flickr and OpenProcessing.

item.title: I Eat Beats
item.description: Alternative musical controller project from earlier this semester, finally added and sightly expanded upon.

item.title: AutoLoop
item.description: First release of AutoLoop, the code that work like a loop pedal (minus the stomping).

item.title: Tintinnabulate
item.description: Overview of work for/with Tintinnabulate last semester: generative visuals, neural networks for destroying the note/parameter distinction.

item.title: Last Words
item.description: A simple instruction piece to be performed by friends in a library.

item.title: Video Reverb
item.description: Spring reverb seems to be a close relative of motion blur.

item.title: Transcoding
item.description: The "resounding" page has been changed to "transcoding" in order to encompass all transcoding-related work, including a recent paper on the subject. I've also started maintaining a transcoding blog.

item.title: Flickr
item.description: I'll be uploading photos on flickr now.

item.title: Ambient Lapse
item.description: A more complete description of the Ambient Lapse process, with another run through Troy.

item.title: Vimeo Account
item.description: I'll be posting videos of experiments and projects here now. You can see my first incarnation of the "Ambient Lapse" idea here.

item.title: Consodance
item.description: A group of computer users must tune themselves in order to recieve a clear video signal.

item.title: lonelygirl512
item.description: UDP based video distortion via packet loss and rearrangement.

item.title: coherent minimalism
item.description: New design. Introducing Improviser, the Chips auralization, SDM, Imitative Art, Resounding, Fontback and Music. A "front page" and a navigation key will be added asap.

item.title: tag clustering
item.description: Foundation for an experimental navigation system.

item.title: dustball
item.description: A generator for a funny object I dreamt up.

item.title: set 31
item.description: A friend's been borrowing my camera, which makes this a good place to pause.

item.title: ring ring
item.description: Simulation of an instruction piece reminiscent of a continuous game of aural "telephone".

item.title: simplify
item.description: "Our life is frittered away by detail... Simplify, simplify, simplify! ... Simplicity of life and elevation of purpose." - Thoreau

item.title: set 30
item.description: From California to New York to Poland. The calm before the storm.

item.title: tag2
item.description: Taking 'tag' from art into the general realm of legitimate genetic programming.

item.title: origami butterfly
item.description: Crazy patterns emergent from a simple algorithm processing a single image.

item.title: chess shapes
item.description: A tool for discovering chess games that take the shape of a specific symbol.

item.title: density
item.description: Moving average of dynamic random data with progressive window sizes. A study in green.

item.title: kiki
item.description: Creating Kiki shapes with a modified K-means clustering algorithm.

item.title: chips
item.description: Emergent behavior at work: 200 wandering souls organize 401 woodchips without any centralized planning.

item.title: 4ct
item.description: I'm in the process of revising my 4ct proof.

item.title: tag
item.description: An adaptive game of tag.

item.title: gpsphotos
item.description: Almost 6000 photos from across the globe, mined from GeoSnapper, visualized in Processing.
